result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Drew E. Lemke was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Drew E. Lemke was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. May serve 1/2 in jail & other 1/2 on electronic monitor, if eligible and risk assessment approved - no jail credit - stayed

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.

timeConds.notes: 14 days must be in jail and balance on Electronic Monitor, if eligible and risk assessment approved, with Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. Go today to get start date.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Drew E. Lemke in court with attorney Leon Stanley Schmidt and Atty Eric McFarland. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim is present today. Cases 16CM19, 16CM124, and 15CM265.
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 16CM19 Cts 1 & 3: No Contest
15CM265 No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 16CM19 Cts 1, Ct 2 and 15CM265.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. 16CM19 Ct 2 is dismissed and 16CM124 is dismissed and read in.
ADA Constable make sentencing recommendation to the Court. 
Atty Schmidt and Atty McFarland concur with joint recommendations.

BY THE COURT:***
16CM19 Count 1: OWI 3rd: 
I/S Probation: 90 days huber 1/2 in jail & 1/2 Electronic Monitor if approved & risk assessment - no jail credit - stayed
12 months Probation:
Conditions:
25 days days jail at 14 day must be in jail and balance on Electronic Monitor, if eligible, with huber. Go today to get start date.
Pay fine $650 + costs = $1,807.00 
Blood Draw $26.45
Revocation of DL: 27 months
IID: 27 months, immediately
DOT Assessment/Safety Plan


16CM19 Count 3:
I/S Probation: 30 days with huber 1/2 in jail & 1/2 electronic monitor, if approved - no jail credit - stayed
12 months Probation:
Conditions:
Pay costs + DNA surcharge.
Comply with same conditions as stated in Count 1 and 15CM265.

15CM265:
I/S Sentence: 150 days in jail first 75 days in jail, and other half on Electronic Monitor, if approved with huber. - no jail credit - stayed
12 months Probation:
Conditions:
Pay costs + DNA surcharges.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Submit DNA sample, if not already done so, and pay the surcharge.
No contact with M. Disher or Disher insurance.
BTC: Pay restitition is $4,555.04 to be paid to Disher and $2,835.00 to Society Insurance.
Report from Pre-Trial Supervision Program
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 5, 2016 at 10:30 am.
and Blank "Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief" Form
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 9, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Drew E. Lemke in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CM-265, 16CM-19 and 16CM-124.

15CM-265: Atty Schmidt is present for this case.
16CM-19 and 16CM-124: Atty McFarland is present for these cases.

2:34 PM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

Court reviews the files.
Back in June, Court explained to the parties how the Court knew the victim and family and indicated that Court would recuse but no one requested a recusal. A restitution hearing was held in front of the Court Commissioner.  Court refers a Branch 1 case that went to appeal, if a denovo hearing could be scheduled. Court reads the decision on the Branch 1 case. 

Atty Schmidt addresses the Court, a hearing was held in front of the Court Commissioner, all parties were present, Court heard testimony and a determination of amount of restitution was set, as stated on the record. 

Court states that Defendant is entitled to a denovo hearing, a new hearing on restitution.

A copy of the unpublished decision is handed to the parties for review.

Parties continue discussions with regards to restitution.

Atty Schmidt hands to the Court findings from the Court Commissioner.  Court reads the decision on the record.
Atty Cousins replies with regards to negotiations on the restitution amount.

Court intends to have a restitution hearing in front of this Court.
Mr. Disher didn't bring any pictures of what the windows look like. Windows don't match.
Atty Schmidt briefly pulled into the parking lot and couldn't tell which were fixed and which were not.
Atty Schmidt requests the Court to view the windows and would like to take a look again.

Atty Schmidt is not going forward today.
Atty McFarland addresses the Court, if not going forward with all of it, might not be able to  go forward with part of it. 

Atty Constable is out of the office, will return next week.

Matters will need to be rescheduled.

Atty Schmidt addresses the Court regarding the restitution.
Mr. Disher addresses the Court regarding ability to pay. 
Atty Schmidt replies.
Defendant will get another kick at the cat.

BY THE COURT:
Bond and conditions of bond are ordered continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Report from Pre-Trial Supervision Program dated July 14, 2016
Plea hearing on July 26, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Drew E. Lemke in court with attorney Leon Stanley Schmidt and Erik McFarland. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin appearing on behalf of Elizabeth Constable.
All files heard: 15CM265, 16CM19, 16CM124
10:50 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Atty Schmidt makes statements to the Court re: agreement.  Requests to reschedule 15CM265.  
Atty McFarland makes statements to the Court.  Without a global agreement, would ask to reschedule all files. 

Court questions parties re: PTSP report.  Reviews the report. 

Victim is present in the Courtroom.  
Court questions victim. 

Parties discuss restitution further. 
Court indicates the Court knows the victim as well as the defendant's mother. 

Court addresses the restitution issue. 

BY THE COURT:  Court will reschedule for reasons stated on the record.   Bond and conditions of bond are continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 26, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
